page.title: 12Effects of Miners Strike
page.content: The strike lasted for 12 months.It made many differences at home like we couldn't have any spending money.We did'nt go out for the day or go on holiday.Miner's children had to go on social security where we got free clothes from a school in Barnsley. We did not see much of our dads. Some of them were picketing and coaling.Each dad took some food with him. They lit a fire and cooked the food . Some worked at coaling (digging coal from illegal and disused sites) while others rested. Every weekday in the school holidays we had to go to the comprehensive school or Meadstead School for our dinners.The miners wives raised some money going round carol singing and used it for parties and presents. Even though it is over we still don't have much money.
